Title: Bangladeshi Student Organization
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The objective of Bangladesh Student Organization (BSO) at University of Texas at Dallas is to promote the culture of Bangladesh in Dallas metroplex and UTD and to assist new students from Bangladesh to adapt at UTD. Approximately 75 members, 7 staff, 3 faculties, over 100 active and involved alumni, as well as guests from the DFW Bangladeshi community are currently part of the organization. With the number of students coming from Bangladesh to UT Dallas growing significantly, BSO is expected to expand in the near future.

Bangladesh is a South Asian country with a rich cultural heritage. By celebrating Bangladeshi festivals, we try to bring a taste of our beloved country and culture to this foreign and diverse land. Aside from helping new students with a smoother transition to university life at UTD, through various events and programs, we represent Bangladesh to Dallas metroplex area, in general, and UTD students, in particular.

The main objectives of the organization will be as follows:

Serve the purpose of exposing the rich and beautiful culture of Bangladesh particularly to but not limited to the University of Texas at Dallas (UTD).
Provide support and assistance to new students arriving to UT Dallas from Bangladesh. This may include transportation, housing and other amenities.
Work toward promoting friendship and interaction among its members and UT Dallas community.
Extend student involvement through volunteering on campus and within the community.
Attempt to serve Bangladesh through fund raising, student scholarship, or in other ways or form possible.
Develop skills in leadership, event management, networking and self-reliance among members of BSO.
Address the challenges encountered by current BSO members.
Act as a voice of the members, if necessary, to represent the student rights, needs, interests and opinions to the Faculty, Staff and Administration in regard to furthering their lives while pursuing higher education at UT Dallas.

Title: CERT UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The initiative to start a Campus Emergency Response Team (CERT) at UTD is motivated by the ability to offer valuable emergency management training at no cost to students, thanks to sponsorship. Typically, comprehensive emergency response training can be quite expensive, often exceeding $1,500 per participant. However, with sponsors able to provide this training for free, it opens up opportunities for many students and staff who might otherwise be unable to afford such essential education. The aim of this organization is to allow students to obtain basic life support certification free of charge within a short period of time. Title: Chabad Jewish Student Organization at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:

The club falls under the SOC categories of Religious, Educational, and Cultural. Chabad serves individuals looking for a warm, non-judgmental, accepting, personalized Jewish experience. We are dedicated to providing every student, regardless of background, philosophy or level of commitment, an open door environment for strengthening and enhancing Jewish life and connection.

Our objectives include but are not limited to; educational, ritual, social activities, counseling and spiritual guidance to individual students. Our organization is based on Chassidic philosophy, as taught locally by the Chabad Jewish Center directed by Rabbi Shmuly and Dini Druk. Our philosophy states that every Jew deserves an equal opportunity to experience and enjoy their heritage. All programs and events of the CJSA are within the framework of Halachah, Jewish law as transmitted by the Rabbis throughout the generations dating back to Moses receiving the Torah at Mount Sinai.

Chabad Jewish Student Association strives to foster a familial environment, emphasizing tradition and Jewish unity. This organization shall be not for profit or non-commercial in nature.

Title: Comet Cinema Club
Category: Academic Interests, Art and Music, Educational/Departmental, Recreation
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission:
The mission of the Comet Cinema Club is to foster a collaborative and creative environment for aspiring filmmakers, actors, writers, and cinematographers at UT Dallas. By providing hands-on experience, professional mentorship, and opportunities for film production, the club aims to empower students to explore their passion for cinema, storytelling, and visual arts while preparing them for success in the entertainment industry.

Purpose:
The purpose of the Comet Cinema Club is to:

Create a community of film enthusiasts at UT Dallas, where students can learn, collaborate, and share their love for cinema.
Offer a platform for students to develop and showcase their skills in filmmaking, writing, acting, directing, and production.
Provide resources and mentorship from industry professionals to guide students in producing high-quality short films, documentaries, and creative media.
Organize film screenings, workshops, and events to engage with the broader UT Dallas community and spark conversations around cinema and storytelling.

Organization Description:
Comet Cinema Club at UT Dallas is a student-run organization dedicated to nurturing creativity and talent in the field of filmmaking. The club consists of two main divisions: the Creative Team, which focuses on the artistic aspects of film production (writing, directing, acting), and the Marketing Team, which handles the promotional, branding, and strategic aspects of film projects and events.

The club's activities include regular meetings, film production projects, industry workshops, and campus-wide events. Members gain hands-on experience in all stages of film creation, from scriptwriting and pre-production to shooting, editing, and marketing the final product. The club also encourages students to participate in national and international short film competitions, providing them with exposure and recognition in the broader film community.

By building a supportive network of student filmmakers and professionals, Comet Cinema Club aims to establish itself as a dynamic hub for innovation and creativity, where students can transform their cinematic visions into reality.

The organisation structure is as follows
Leadership Team:

President: The President of Envision serves as the visionary leader, guiding the organization towards its overarching goals and objectives. They are responsible for overall strategic planning, representing the organization externally, and nurturing a culture of collaboration and excellence within the team.
Vice President: Working closely with the President, the Vice President plays a crucial role in overseeing day-to-day operations and supporting various initiatives within the organization. They step in to assist the President as needed and ensure the smooth functioning of all Envision activities.
Secretary of Communications (SOC): The SOC is the voice of Envision, responsible for managing internal and external communications. They oversee public relations, social media presence, and ensure that members are informed about upcoming events, opportunities, and organizational updates.
General Secretary: The General Secretary acts as the organizational backbone, handling administrative tasks, maintaining records, and facilitating communication between different departments within Envision. They ensure that meetings run smoothly, minutes are documented, and decisions are implemented effectively.
Treasurer: As the financial steward of Envision, the Treasurer manages the organization's budget, finances, and fundraising efforts. They work to secure resources needed to support Envision's activities and ensure fiscal responsibility and transparency.

Kappa Theta Pi was founded on January 10, 2012, in Ann Arbor, Michigan, and is the University of Michigan's first and only professional technology fraternity. The goals of the fraternity are to create bonds between students of Informatics, computer science, business, design, computer engineering, Information,[2] and any others who are interested in technology, to develop networks through facilitation of professional and social growth, and to expose members to career options in the technology field.

Title: Kappa Theta Pi Mu Chapter
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The goals of the fraternity are to create bonds between students of Informatics, computer science, business, design, computer engineering, Information, and any others who are interested in technology, to develop networks through facilitation of professional and social growth, and to expose members to career options in the technology field.

Title: Keep in Mind
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We aim to encourage knowledgeable and healthy discussion of mental health care, mental illness, and coping mechanisms through educational resources, advocate for mental health issues by fostering and cultivating a more positive environment for those struggling in our local community, and to create awareness and reduce the stigma surrounding mental health care and illness amongst the student population with a focus on multicultural factors.

Title: Kesem
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
5 million children are coping with a parent's cancer diagnosis.
That’s 5 million children at risk of experiencing increased anxiety, emotional isolation, loss of social interest, and/or feelings of hopelessness. And that’s why, at Kesem, we are committed to creating a world where every child who has a parent with a cancer diagnosis or has lost a parent to cancer is never alone. We support these children through and beyond their parent’s cancer with free, fun-filled creative programs and a lasting community.

Title: Kidney Disease Screening & Awareness Program (KDSAP) at UTDallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Kidney Disease Screening & Awareness Program (KDSAP) is an organization dedicated to serving local communities through free kidney health screenings and providing kidney health education to both members and the community.

Title: Korean International Student Association of Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We ensure the preservation and growth of Korean American community at the University of Texas at Dallas by providing cultural and professional development opportunities to those with a keen interest in the Korean culture.

Title: Korean Language Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: KLC is an educational / cultural club designed to help and individuals in UT Dallas who are willing to improve their Korean language skills or get more involved in exploring Korean culture. KLC provides weekly Korean classes volunteered by native / advanced students in UT Dallas, along with bi-weekly social events for community, cultural, and language exchange.

Title: Korean Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Korean Student Association (KSA) is a vibrant and dynamic organization committed to fostering a strong sense of academic among Korean and non-Korean students at our university. Our mission is to facilitate academic growth and cross-cultural understanding. At the core of our purpose is the belief that diversity should be embraced and celebrated, particularly within an academic context. We strive to provide an inclusive and academically stimulating environment where students from all backgrounds can engage in educational activities, share their knowledge, and learn about Korean culture and society.

Title: Laksh Indian Dance Team
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to keep our culture and background alive through dance.

Title: Last Writers Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Last Writers aims to provide an opportunity for the contemplation and documentation of a life well-lived. For our patients, this means allowing them to tell their biographical stories, record important memories, and emphasize the beliefs and ideals that have meant the most to them. For students, we aim to provide an opportunity to work with patients and families in hospice and palliative care through a glimpse into end-of-life healthcare, interviewing and memoir writing, and the combination of both into narrative medicine. By collecting this information and compiling it into a tangible whole, we hope to bring comfort to everyone involved in a form that endures - a Last Writers memoir.

Title: Latter-day Saint Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The Latter-Day Saint Student Association is a group for those students who are members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints and any who are interested in learning more about our faith and socializing with those who hold our beliefs. As Latter-Day Saints, we believe that Jesus Christ is our Savior, and that He is the Son of God. We also believe that God continues to speak to His children today, and that he calls prophets to teach His people just like he did in antiquity. We believe that The Book of Mormon is another example of God's words to his children, and that it testifies of Jesus Christ. If you have any interest in learning more about Latter-day Saint beliefs, or just socializing with those of the faith, feel free to come to any of our meetings and activities!

LDSSA hosts weekly scripture/doctrinal classes on campus (with free food) ﻿and meet with those interested in learning our beliefs in a smaller group setting with full-time missionaries. Those interested in more of our church's social events should be aware that most of our activities are off campus and NOT UTD affiliated.

Title: League of Legends at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of LOLUTD is to bring together a community of people who play League of Legends or are interested in it.

Title: League of United Latin American Citizens
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The mission of the League of United Latin American Citizens is to advance the economic condition, educational attainment, political influence, housing, health, and civil rights of the Hispanic population of the United States and Puerto Rico.

Title: Lemon Club at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of the Lemon Club at UT Dallas is to raise awareness and funds for pediatric cancer research through Alex’s Lemonade Stand Foundation.

Title: Let's Learn Italian Together
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: As Italian is not a language course offered here at UTD, our organization provides a place for those who want to learn Italian to come together, study, share their methods, and have a safe place to practice their Italian as they progress.

Title: Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS)
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission:
The mission of LLS chapter at UT Dallas is to raise awareness, advocate for research, and provide support for those affected by blood cancers, including leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease, and myeloma. Through educational initiatives, fundraising efforts, and community engagement, we aim to make a tangible impact in the fight against blood cancers and contribute to finding cures.

Purpose:
The LLS Chapter at UT Dallas educates, inspires, and empowers students from all academic backgrounds to take action in the fight against blood cancers. We provide opportunities for students to engage in meaningful service projects, participate in fundraising activities, and build a supportive community dedicated to improving the lives of patients and their families. Our chapter will collaborate with health organizations, raise awareness, and promote the importance of advancing blood cancer research and patient care.

Organization:
It is a student-led organization dedicated to supporting the mission of the national Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. We strive to foster a sense of responsibility and empathy among students through a variety of initiatives, including educational campaigns, charity events, and partnerships with other campus organizations. Members of our chapter work together to organize unique events such as awareness workshops and health fairs to support the LLS mission.

Title: Life Skills Club at The University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Life Skills at UTD is a student-led service organization at the University of Texas at Dallas. The organization will focus on providing fun and practical activities that will allow students to learn important general skills for life. We will focus on individual growth and will cover a broad array of skills that are not specific to students’ major or career path. We also will bring the UTD community together through enjoyable workshops in a stress-free environment, thus allowing people from different academic backgrounds to meet and interact.

Title: Magic the Gathering Club at The University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The members of this organization strive to foster an environment in which students can learn, teach, and play Magic: the Gathering; to uphold the principles of sportsmanship, fairplay, and mutual respect; to grow the community of new players without retracting from the enjoyment of those more experienced; and, above all, to create variable, interactive, and enjoyable games of Magic: the Gathering.

Title: Magic UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Magic UTD is a community of magicians from all different skill levels and backgrounds. Our goal is to hone and refine our knowledge of magic with fellow magicians and get new people interested in the art form.

We also run magic shows throughout the semester. All members will be given an opportunity to rehearse and perform in front of a live audience. For each show, those interested in performing will gather for scriptwriting and dress rehearsals. It's a great way to show off what you have learned in the semester!

We are a diverse group of students committed to bridging the gap between the possible and the impossible! We would love for you to join us!

Title: Making Healthcare Affordable
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Student organization dedicated to raising awareness about healthcare accessibility through volunteering, fundraising, donation drives, advocacy, and letter-writing events.

Title: Malankara Orthodox Christian Student Movement
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The primary purpose of Orthodox Christian Student Movement is to serve the needs of it members and strengthen the partnership with DSWA Campus Ministry in the following ways:

Bring our students into mainstream religious life and to maintain their active involvement in our church.

Provide them with a deeper understanding and awareness of our faith, traditions and practices.

Enhance Bible Study and develop personal devotional practices and prayer.

Develop and promote a stable and fruitful spiritual life with a commitment to Christ and His Church and participation in the mission of charity.

Promote friendship and bonding among the members.

Initiate and maintain spiritual counseling with problem solving in everyday life.

Assist them in setting up appropriate educational objectives and programs of study.

Assist with any needed help in financial planning.

Title: Malayali Comet Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Malayali Comet Association is driven by a commitment to preserving and promoting Malayali culture, fostering inclusivity and community, supporting member growth and development, educating others about Kerala's heritage, collaborating with partners, and advocating for the interests of its members.

Title: MannMukti UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission:
Encourage healthy, open dialogue of South Asian mental health issues in an effort to remove stigma, improve awareness and promote self-care.

Purpose:
Promote mental health and provide valuable resources to help everyone facilitate their mental well-being

Organization Description
To educate and spread more awareness about mental health, especially in the South Asian communities.

Title: Mantra Lounge
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To promote healthy and conscious lifestyle among all in and around campus.

Title: Math Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
We will gather to collaborate in solving and proposing math problems to improve our
problem solving skills. Anyone can come by and check out the club and meet other
people interested in math to have someone to talk with about math. We also have a
discord server for additional math discussions.

Title: MBAs for Christ
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
MBAs for Christ exists to glorify God by encouraging graduate JSOM Students in
their devotion and submission to Jesus Christ. This organization is “religious,” as defined by the
SOC.
We affirm the following core values:
1.Our Identity is in Christ“...for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, and are justified by
his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.” (Romans 3:23-24)Despite the
pressures of the professional world, we deny that our identity, purpose, or personal worth is found
in our professional success, productivity, or performance. Rather, we affirm that our lives are in
Jesus Christ, the One who has justified and redeemed us through His broken body and spilt blood.
2.Our Purpose is to Pursue Christ“See to it that no one takes you captive by philosophy and empty
deceit, according to human tradition, according to the elemental spirits of the world, and not
according to Christ. For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily, and you have been filled in
him, who is the head of all rule and authority.” (Colossians2:8-10)Even as we learn important
business lessons as graduate students at UTD, we affirm our reliance on and submission to Jesus
Christ. We commit to pursuing Christ in all things, trusting in His sufficiency, authority, and
wisdom. We choose to exalt Jesus, His perspective, and His wisdom above all else.3.Our Work is our
Worship “Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, knowing that from the
Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.” (Colossians
3:23-24)As working professionals and students, we believe our careers are an offering unto Jesus
Christ. As such, we seek to integrate our faith and work under the leadership of the Holy Spirit and
unto the glory of our Father in Heaven.
4.Our Unity is in our Devotion to Christ and our Love for One Another “This is my commandment,
that you love one another as I have loved you.” (John 15:12)
In accordance with the historic creeds of the church (that is, the Nicene Creed and the Apostle’s
Creed, see Appendix A), we affirm that our love for Jesus Christ compels us to love one another as
He first loved us. In all things, we seek to show Christ-like love in word and deed to our fellow
JSOM students, our co-workers, and our communities

Title: Mechanical Engineering Graduate Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The MEGA represents the views and recommendations of the mechanical engineering (ME)
graduate student body across campus and works closely with the Department of Mechanical
Engineering to mutually improve both entities. MEGA operates in a manner to support
diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Title: Med Ethics UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission Statement
Our mission is to foster a deeper understanding of medical ethics by creating an environment where students can engage in meaningful discussions, volunteer in underserved communities, and collaborate with organizations dedicated to improving healthcare access. We aim to equip future healthcare professionals with the ethical foundation necessary to navigate the complexities of modern medicine.

Purpose
Med Ethics UTD aims to explore ethical issues in modern medicine while giving back to the community. We engage in discussions, volunteer work, and fundraising to help improve healthcare in underserved areas.

Organization Description
Med Ethics UTD is a student group focused on ethical discussions in healthcare and helping the community. We host discussions about important medical topics and partner with organizations to support local underserved areas. Through volunteering and fundraising, we strive to make a positive impact while learning about the ethics of medicine.

Title: Medical City Dallas Volunteers Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
To recruit UTD students and give them exclusive access to Medical City Dallas' volunteer program

To be a community space for active volunteers

To give UTD students the opportunity to gain service hours

To support Medical City's programs by broadcasting events and drives to the greater Dallas area

Title: Medical Engineering Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Join the Medical Engineering Association and unlock a world of interdisciplinary collaboration where engineering meets healthcare. Dive into workshops, competitions, and projects tailored to cultivate your skills and ignite your passion for medical innovation. Whether you're an engineer, pre-health student, or tech enthusiast, our inclusive community invites you to explore, create, and make a tangible impact on the future of medicine. Open to all levels and planning to launch a community service initiative in Fall 2024.

Title: Medical Ethics Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The UTD Medical Ethics Association is dedicated to fostering a deep understanding of ethical principles in the medical field. We aim to create a platform where students, faculty, and professionals can engage in thoughtful dialogue, explore diverse perspectives, and address the complex ethical challenges faced in modern healthcare. Through education, discussion, and advocacy, we strive to promote integrity, compassion, and respect for all individuals in the pursuit of ethical excellence in medicine.

Title: Medicine, Education, and Development for Low Income Families Everywhere (MEDLIFE)
Category: Academic Interests, Services, Social, Special Interest
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission: To build a worldwide movement empowering the poor in their fight for equal access to healthcare, education, and a safe home.
Purpose: Empower UT Dallas students to work locally and internationally to assist with infrastructure, development, and relief projects. Provide members with career advancement and networking opportunities, including, but not limited, to pre-health students.

Title: Melisma Classical Vocal Ensemble
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Melisma Classical Vocal Ensemble is a student-led vocal group dedicated to exploring, studying, and performing primarily Western early/classical vocal music. The organization provides a space for members to develop their individual voices and provides opportunities for musicians to collaborate within and outside the organization. Melisma Classical Vocal Ensemble strives to educate the local community about classical vocal music and singing in general.

Title: Memories Matter
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our organization is dedicated to improving the quality of life of older adults afflicted by conditions linked with aging. We achieve our mission through three fundamental pillars: raising awareness, fundraising, and enhancing care.

Title: Minecraft: Java Edition Club at the University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The primary goal of the club is to bring together students who share a passion for Minecraft: Java Edition and provide them with a platform to explore various aspects of the game. The club will focus on activities such as modding, texture pack creation, Hypixel gameplay, Hardcore Mode challenges, and much more.

Title: Minority Assoication of Pre-Medical Students
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students (MAPS) is committed to supporting current and future underrepresented minority medical students, addressing the needs of underserved communities, and increasing the number of clinically excellent, culturally competent, and socially conscious physicians.

Title: Mise En Place
Category: Academic Interests, Cultural, Social, Special Interest
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Mise En Place’s mission is to provide a congenial platform for students to pursue their culinary interests and lead a dynamic life with the love of food. The purpose of this organization is to offer a welcoming environment where university students learn to cook and nurture a passion in the creation of various dishes. Furthermore, Mise En Place foster meaningful connections among students through shared culinary experiences and build a tight-knit community of like-minded individuals united over the universal language of food. At Mise En Place, we hope to host workshops and events focused on educating students (and the broader community) regarding nutrition, mindful eating, and overall wellness.

Title: Molding Doctors at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: As a pre-medical organization, our goal is to empower aspiring physicians to achieve their fullest potential. We are driven by our commitment to fostering a supportive community; one that equips students with the resources, guidance, and opportunities to excel academically, professionally, and personally.

Title: MOVE Texas UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our vision is to build the political power of young people to transform democracy in Texas and beyond.

Title: Muslim Interscholastic Tournament
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission: MIST inspires high school students to collaborate and compete, develop creative skills, and learn from professionals, while educating them about Islam and Muslims. We envision a vibrant community of creativity, knowledge, and mutual respect.
Description and Purpose: We offer students all over DFW the chance to encourage self discovery, knowledge related to Islam and/or Muslims, creativity, communication skills, critical thinking and problem solving, and interpersonal skills.
We are open to individuals of any religion, race, color, gender, sex, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, and socio-economic background.
MIST exposes participants to aspects of Muslim customs and practices, but does not enforce religious adherence. We encourage attitudes of respect in relation to religious or philosophical disagreement.

Title: Muslim Professionals at UTDallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The mission of the Organization is to provide a supportive and empowering platform for the Muslim population on campus, focusing on professional development, networking, and career exploration in various career clusters.

Title: Muslim Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: As the Muslim Students Association, our aim and purpose is to provide an atmosphere in which members can experience a sense of fellowship according to the authentic teachings of Islam, promote friendly relations and interfaith dialogue between Muslims and non-Muslims, and endeavor to make Islamic teachings known to those who are interested.

Title: National Association of Black Accountants
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The mission is to empower black business leaders at every step in the journey

Title: National Association of Women MBAs - UT-Dallas Chapter
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: NAWMBA is a distinctive community (organization) of professionals committed to the advancement of women in business. This chapter will include a group of committed women and other individuals who identify with our mission: propelling women MBA students and professionals into leadership positions in business.

Title: National Black Law Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: NBLSA aims to increase the number of culturally responsible Black and minority attorneys who excel academically, succeed professionally, and positively impact the community.

Title: National Retail Federation Foundation
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of the National Retail Federation Foundation is to assist members in leadership development as well as unite in a common professional bond without regard to race, creed, sex, or national origin. To foster an understanding of the functions of labor, entrepreneurial, and management organizations in the American free enterprise system.

Title: National Society of Black Engineers
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: NSBE's mission is to increase the number of culturally responsible Black engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community.

Title: National Society of Black Women in Medicine
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The National Society of Black Women in Medicine is a multi-disciplined organization that
works to increase the recruitment and retention of Black women pursuing broad careers in
medicine, while simultaneously promoting the advancement of those already established in
these fields.

Title: National Student Speech-Language Hearing Association (NSSLHA)
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Mission statement: We, the members of the National Student Speech Language Hearing Association, are an academic organization that serves primarily speech-language pathology and audiology students but welcome all enrolled at UTD. NSSLHA is the only national student organization for pre-professionals studying communication sciences and disorders recognized by ASHA. UTD's NSSLHA chapter provides opportunities in these areas: social, academic/professional, philanthropic, service, and leadership.

Title: Nebula Labs
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Nebula Labs is an interdisciplinary group of designers 🎨, engineers 💾 , marketers 📈, and product managers 🧭 that build open-source software for the UTD community. We are always looking for devoted students that want to help solve problems students face around campus, and we hope that is you!

Title: Nepalese Graduate Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The main purpose of the NGSA social club is to provide a welcoming and supportive community to all Nepalese Students at UTD through a variety of activities and initiatives. One of the primary goals is to serve new graduate students by assisting them in finding suitable housing options that meet their needs and budget. NGSA provides a platform for all Nepalese at UTD to share their experiences and perspectives and helps them learn more about how to use the university’s resources and navigate university life and beyond.

Title: Nepalese Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of the Nepalese Student Association is to promote Nepali culture and heritage within the University of Texas at Dallas and to give back to the community.

Title: Neurorder
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: An academic interest organization striving to integrate medicinal, research and industrial neuroscience by providing collaborative and hands-on opportunities for future readiness. Our organization believes that collaborative experiences with like-minded people will be beneficial. Key components of participating in the scientific community include understanding how the knowledge we gain can be applied in the real world, current trends in research, communicating with other individuals about our findings, and refining existing methods for the betterment of society. Neurorder will help undergraduate neuroscience students be prepared for the future, regardless of the track they are on. We hope to provide a plethora of opportunities for neuroscience students to gain knowledge, step out of their comfort zones, discover new interests within the field, and understand real life applications of neuroscience.

Title: Neuroscience Graduate Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Neuroscience Graduate Student Association (NGSA) is dedicated to promoting strong bonding in the department through educational and social support among graduate students in the field of neuroscience. NGSA is a student-led organization that values a supportive and inclusive community for diversity, professional development, and social engagement. We provide a platform for graduate students: 1) to connect with one another through social events, 2) to facilitate professional development through networking opportunities, and 3) to build leadership through advocating for each other. As a group, we are committed to providing our members with a supportive and engaging community that facilitates their academic and personal growth.

Title: Neuroscience Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We are a community of those interested in neuroscience that support each other to build on skills, experiences, and inspire each other through collaborative events and community outreach.

Title: Newman Catholic Ministry
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: As Catholics at the University of Texas at Dallas, we seek to build up the Catholic community, reach out to Catholics on campus, and be the presence of Christ to those around us. To that purpose, we seek to sponsor events that proclaim the truths of our faith, offer opportunities for fellowship, and draw students deeper into a life of prayer, sacraments, and a relationship with Christ and His Church. We use our resources of time, talent, and treasure to promote and implement our missions and events.

Title: Noor Al-Yateem
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to provide unwavering support, love, and a nurturing environment for orphaned and refugee children, empowering them to thrive despite their circumstances. Through comprehensive care, education, and mentorship, we aim to instill confidence, skills, and hope for a brighter future. Committed to each child's holistic development, we foster a sense of belonging and family, ensuring their emotional, physical, and psychological well-being. Our organization strives to equip these beautiful souls with the tools and opportunities needed to become self-resilient, compassionate individuals, positively impacting their communities and beyond.

Title: Novis A Capella
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We are the oldest and most premier A Capella group at UTD. We are a small group of music lovers who share passion for singing and performing. We perform contemporary songs and perform at events across UTD and the community.

Title: Novis A Cappella
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Novis A Cappella aims to reach wider UT Dallas student body and spread the joy that music brings to all of us! Our singers are incredibly talented and passionate about the music we sing and our constantly excited to reach higher limits as an organization.

Title: Office of Student Volunteerism
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Office of Student Volunteerism is committed to enriching the lives of students by educating them on and connecting them to, the needs of their campus community, and communities across the country and around the world. By directly providing students at The University of Texas at Dallas with opportunities to volunteer their time to local community service projects and partnering with campus departments, programs, faculty, and student organizations, as well as being a repository for community service resources, the Office of Student Volunteerism helps students prepare for life, work, and leadership as active, responsible citizens.

Title: Olympic Weightlifting at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To spread the sport of Olympic Weightlifting to the people of UTD

Title: One For All
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: One For All's purpose is to promote spiritual inclusivity and dialogue to educate and inspire college students towards peace and purity by creating an environment of meaningful discussion about God, Guidance, and Goodness through preparing members to contribute to a global, diverse community from the teachings of the Qur’an and through the example of Prophet Muhammad.

Title: One Good Cookie
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Our mission at One Good Cookie is to create a space where UTD students can come together to participate in service-based activities. Through baking, crafting, and writing personalized cards, we aim to show appreciation and bring joy to residents in local nursing homes.

The purpose of One Good Cookie is to build a supportive and compassionate community that actively contributes to the well-being of others. Through both volunteer work and fundraising efforts, we seek to provide local nursing home residents with thoughtful, handmade gifts and essential items, while fostering a spirit of service and collaboration among students.

One Good Cookie is a student-led organization at UTD that blends hands-on community service with creative activities. In addition to making baked goods and spending quality time with nursing home residents, we seek to host cookie sales to raise funds. These funds will then be used to purchase essential supplies like clothing, blankets, and hygiene products for elderly residents. Our organization serves as a platform for students to engage in meaningful work while connecting with their peers and giving back to an under appreciated community.

Title: OpenUTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Embracing, educating, and contributing to open source software and the culture surrounding it

Title: Operation Smile UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Operation Smile dreams of a world where no child born with facial deformities suffers from a lack of access to safe surgery. We aim to raise awareness and improve the lives of children in developing nations. Global involvement is important to us. The US is a developed nation and therefore we have the resources to help people in developing countries that do not have access to them. In this way we wish to make a global change by raising money towards this cause through fundraising events. We wanted to start this organization with the intent of becoming a part of our global community with a unified purpose in hopes of making a lasting difference by investing in the future. Through this journey, we would want to create lasting relationships, but also teach people about cultural differences and humanitarian values by opening their eyes to the world around them.

Title: Orthodox Christian Campus Ministries
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
OCCM anchors college students to the values and ancient faith of the Orthodox Christian Church through fellowship, prayer, service to others, and study of the faith.

Our mission statement stems from four pillars of the Orthodox Christian lifestyle: orthodoxia, orthopraxia, orthokoinonia, and orthokrisia. These are the correct belief (faith), correct acts/practice, correct community, and correct judgment and values.

Title: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Orthodox Christian Fellowship of UT Dallas is committed to creating a home for the Orthodox Christians of UT Dallas. We are a place where Orthodox Christians can feel safe, accepted, and heard. As a religious club, we are also committed to making sure that the religious needs and questions of both Orthodox and non-Orthodox students of UTD are heard and answered.

Title: Out in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (oSTEM)
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: oSTEM empowers LGBTQ+ people in STEM to succeed personally, academically, and professionally by cultivating environments and communities that nurture innovation, leadership, and advocacy.

Title: Out in Tech at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To unite the LGBTQ+ tech community by creating opportunities for our members to advance their careers, grow their networks, and leverage tech for social change.

Title: Pakistani Students Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We organize Pakistani events on campus for the Overseas Pakistanis and those who want to learn about the culture. Our events are educational and cultural, talking about books, poetry and weddings in Pakistan.

Title: Palette Hope
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Palette Hope is an organization that allows individuals within campuses to receive emotional support and find HOPE through creativity. We are dedicated to providing art supplies as well as safe spaces throughout campuses where art can be used to promote personal growth. With the use of art, we are able to bring topics such as depression, anxiety, substance abuse, eating disorders, and sexual abuse to a wider platform.

Title: Paper for Water
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Paper for Water strives to exchange origami kusudamas (paper ornaments with Japanese roots) for charitable donations that fund the development of delivering and establishing clean water in communities with little access to such. This organization is primarily under the service category, while supplementing with education about countries suffering from a shortage of potable water and ways we can mitigate this long-standing issue. In addition to working with the PfW nonprofit, our UTD chapter is eager to involve the introduction of a variety of other crafts including crochet, needle-felting, clay work, and ribbon-folding to invigorate the artistic community on campus and direct amplified attention on PfW’s mission and UTD’s creative student body simultaneously.

Title: Partners In Health Engage at the University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Partners In Health is a global health and social justice organization dedicated to addressing global health inequities through the provision of high-quality health care to the world’s poorest and sickest communities and through activism for the universal human right to health. Through solidarity with local governments, sister organizations, and community members, Partners In Health aims to provide a comprehensive model of care to provide a cure to injustice.

The mission of Partners In Health Engage at UTD is to support and amplify Partner In Health’s efforts to advance global health equity by building the right to health movement. We work to:
Advocate for policies that enable governments to build functioning health systems
Fundraise to support Partner In Health’s lifesaving programs
Educate the public about global health and the unconscionable injustices faced by marginalized populations.

Title: Peace Africa Coffee Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
PEACE AFRICA COFFEE CLUB (d.b.a.
"Amani Coffee Club") is a student club dedicated to developing a practical, tangible model of sustainable business development and poverty alleviation. We'll do this by partnering with Cyimbili Coffee Plantation in Cyimbili, Rwanda, and surrounding farms to enrich the lives of Cyimbili farmers, their families, and their community. Using a direct trade model, we aim to sell coffee produced by Cyimbili farmers to local roasteries, cafes, and UTD students. In addition, we plan to host events where we'll brew and sell coffee to UTD students while promoting our mission and educating them about its importance and potential impact. In doing this, we'll help to continue the transformation of a community that was once devastated by the Rwandan Genocide but is now beginning to thrive thanks to the rehabilitation of the Cyimbili Coffee Plantation. As a social organization, we also strive to create a welcoming space where students can engage in meaningful conversations, share diverse perspectives, and cultivate unity over coffee. Through our focus on the intersection of coffee and dialogue, we aim to promote understanding, build connections, and inspire a sense of global citizenship among our members. This club falls under the social and educational SOC.

Our community is so beautiful and diverse that learning these phrases could help patients be more comfortable and communicate more easily with health professionals to get the best care. In this club, we would also like to make sure there is a sense of support and education of cultures, so we would like to discuss many cultural differences and different barriers that are present in the medical field, system, and our community overall, to help utd students who are pre-health, and even non-healthcare, so that they can use these skills in their future, to help the community.

Title: Pre-Optometry Professional Society
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The Pre-optometry professional society (POPS) was first introduced to UTD in 2006, and aims to inform prospective optometry students about all aspects of the field of optometry. This includes admission requirements and application processes for entry to make competitive applicants. POPS also aims to be a community leader by giving students opportunities to give back to the community, and develop their social and technical skills. Here at POPS, we also give students a chance to meet new people with the same interests in Optometry. From conference trips, fundraisers, and volunteering opportunities, we look forward to seeing you all!
Volunteering is a big part of our organization. At POPS, we love to volunteer at the Saturday Low Vision Clinic in Dallas. Not only do we give students a glimpse into the world of Optometry, but we also get to help our community. We also volunteer with Prevent Blindness in Texas, the Hot Chocolate Run in Dallas, and more! Volunteering has given us the opportunity to grow stronger as an organization and empower our community.
Some of the greatest UTD POPS traditions are the trips we take during the second semester. There are fun social trips like surviving escape rooms, and informative trips such as touring Optometry graduate schools like the University of Houston. These outings really solidify the bonds of our members and aid us in our future as an Optometrist. Whether you are thinking of becoming an optometrist, definitive about your optometry future, or just looking for a little fun, POPS trips are memories that you will cherish for a lifetime.
In order to keep the organization running, we bring the community together through multiple fundraisers each semester. Most of the locations are near UTD to make it easier for them to come out and show support! Fundraisers help us raise money for the trips we take part in each year, the great opportunities we provide for our members, and speakers who come and talk about Optometry!

Title: Sahaja Yoga Meditation Club

Through establishing this organization the aim will be to coordinate and work with differing projects and connect UTD students to these organizations devoted to promoting global relief. We value dedication, teamwork, empathy and equal opportunity for everyone so that they can receive the education that they deserve.

Title: Scientific Computing Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Many incoming freshmen, sophomores, and even long-standing upperclassmen will major in a STEM subject, none the wiser to the importance of having command of one or more programming languages for scientific use. With the increasing availability of PCs, and the outstanding need to perform more rigorous and expensive calculations, knowing how to code a simple algorithm makes a proper difference in the eligibility of a job applicant. Knowing this, the Scientific Computing Club intends to (with a multi-disciplinary approach) inform interested students about methods in scientific computing, and to provide the experience of working in tandem with a computer to expand the range of a future scientist or engineer to tackle problems that are impossible with the range of pen and paper.

Modern problems in STEM will be solved for with the use of computers to illustrate the need for knowledge of these methods, and opportunities that may make use of the knowledge learned from this club (employment, research, etc.) will be provided to interested students. Students will be able to tie these methods to current courses to gain intimate experience about the benefits of computing literacy. The rudimentary goal of the Scientific Computing Club is to allow students to confidently work concurrently with computing methods to grow their confidence in future pursuits, and to become a better scientist overall.
