Category: Art and Music, Cultural, Social, Special Interest
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Strings Attached is a social music club based at The University of Texas at Dallas. Strings Attached (abv. StAt) hosts a wide variety of events: these include jam sessions, socials, open mics, and our concerts! The ultimate goal of Strings Attached is to encourage the collaboration of musicians across all genres and walks of life and to provide a place for all students to express their love for music and performance.

Title: Student Chess Society
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: This recreational organization is established to target all UTD students and faculty (as well as outside members), who enjoy playing chess or would like to learn how to play or would like to master the skills involved in playing chess

Title: Student Game Developer Association
Category: Academic Interests, Recreation, Social, Special Interest
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
It is the primary purpose of the Student Game Developer Association of the University of Texas at Dallas to represent and serve students, and provide a unified voice in student dealings with individuals and agencies outside of the Association. This includes, but is not limited to, the following:
- Serving as a forum for the presentation of student interests and desires pertinent to game development for social, educational, and professional advancement.
- Enhancing the intellectual life of the University by ensuring that opportunity is available for students to expose themselves to various facets of game development for personal, commercial, and academic purposes.
- Representing those ideals, goals, and programs that are of general student interest to the administration and other groups within and without the University structure.
- Working with the administration and faculty to ensure that adequate programs are provided

Title: Student Government
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The mission of the Student Government is to ensure that UT Dallas is fully committed to serving the collective interests of the student body. In this capacity, we serve as the official student voice to UT Dallas administration, the UT System Board of Regents, and other governmental entities.





The Student Government seeks to enhance spirit, protect University traditions, and support all students and student organizations in their academic and community-directed endeavors.





For further information, including information about elections, meeting times, and past projects, please visit our website at sg.utdallas.edu.

Title: Student Leadership Programs
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Student Leadership Programs offer leadership training throughout the academic year. Our goal is to create, facilitate and foster leadership learning opportunities and experiences for all students.

Title: Student Organization Center
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The Student Organization Center, affectionately known as SOC, assists students in connecting to the UT Dallas community. There are over 300 registered student organizations on campus. Wherever your passions lie, you're sure to find a place to call home.

We encourage all Comets to Explore. Engage. Create.

Title: Student Tutors Reviving Identity through Volunteerism and Education
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
STRIVE was founded in 2019 to help underprivileged students in the DFW metroplex have the chance to live up to their true potential. Our initiative first started as a means for Refugee and ESL students to work with select mentors. Our work focused on helping the students overcome language barriers, learn that diversity is indeed accepted, and to think beyond primary education. This initiative was a success as we had a lot of students interested in higher education after various discussions.
Unfortunately, many of them struggled to gain acceptance due to the compounding effects of the language barrier. Without a solid grasp of English, performance in various other subjects takes a significant hit. Based on this dilemma, we decided that it was essential to develop a tutoring program for these students to connect them with tutor-mentors from similar backgrounds who would guide the students and allow them to overcome this barrier.
We see a bright future for these students, and we want to tap into their potential by providing them with one-on-one subject strategy training and educational advice. Our motto is that every student should have the right to succeed regardless of their background. Language should not be an obstacle to success. We currently work with Lake Highlands High School in the Richardson Independent School District (RISD). Currently looking to expand, we look forward to continuing our mission to eliminate educational disparities.

Title: Students for Justice in Palestine
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We stand unequivocally for collective liberation of all oppressed peoples and more specifically the liberation of Palestine and the return of their people.

Title: Students for Middle Eastern Education and Relief
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our club aims to educate UTD students in an effort to reverse stereotypes and misconceptions about the Middle East while raising funds for emergency relief. The purpose of this is to ensure our peers learn about the complexities and immense culture the Middle East has to offer. Our organization will host informational meetings, culture nights, and fundraisers among many other events.

Title: Students for Neurodiversity Aligned Practices
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission: Our mission is to create an inclusive and supportive community that celebrates neurodiversity and advocates for practices that affirm and embrace the diverse strengths, challenges, and perspectives of individuals with neurological differences.

Purpose: To connect and network with students, staff and faculty members who have an interest in learning about the neurodiversity paradigm and incorporating neurodiversity aligned practices into their professions. We offer professional development opportunities such as guest speakers from various fields and community advocacy and educational initiatives.

Organization Description: We are a student-led organization of future leaders in various fields committed to promoting understanding, respect, and acceptance for neurodivergent individuals within our campus and broader community. We offer opportunities to learn from neurodiversity- affirming professionals as well as create awareness and advocate for the implementation of neurodiversity aligned practices. All neurotypes are welcome!

Title: Students of East Africa
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Students of East Africa (S.E.A.) embodies and represents a grand-scale of East African ethnicities at The University of North Texas. This organization consists of countries such as Ethiopia, Eritrea, Somalia, Uganda, Djibouti, Burundi, Rwanda, Tanzania, Kenya, Sudan, and South Sudan. Through the act community service, this organization will provide a means for students to connect with surrounding communities by lending a helping hand to those in need. The overall goal of this organization aims to create a safe space, where professional and social connections are harvested. S.E.A. will provide opportunities for students to learn about various cultures, develop meaningful relationships, and unite the East African community as a whole.

Title: Taiwanese Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Established with the primary objective of nurturing a robust sense of community and support among Taiwanese students on campus, the association is dedicated to delivering vital services, including orientation, consultation, and information dissemination, to aid members in navigating university life and the broader Dallas area, as well as in exploring their career pathways. Moreover, TSA endeavors to elevate cultural awareness by showcasing the rich traditions and customs of Taiwan, fostering meaningful interactions and collaborations with other organizations, providing support to Taiwanese international students, and fostering an inclusive and welcoming environment conducive to the free exchange of experiences and ideas among members. By steadfastly upholding democratic principles and embracing inclusivity, the Constitution ensures that TSA remains a dynamic and valuable.

Title: Taking Real Understanding To Heart Bible club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Reveal the profound mystery of Elohim God, and other prophecies testified in the bible to UTD students, volunteer, and do other events and activities.

Title: Talk 2 The Hand
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Provide a space for UTD students to authentically learn about ASL, Deaf Culture, and the local Deaf community.

Title: TaRaas UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: UTD TaRaas is UTD's premier competitive Raas/Garba dance team. Through Raas/Garba, we aim to provide our members a means to create lifelong friendships and have fun.

Title: Tau Beta Pi
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Tau Beta Pi is a preeminent engineering honor society that supports the professional development of students in the engineering disciplines. The Tau Beta Pi creed is integrity and excellence in engineering.

Title: Tau Sigma National Honor Society
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission- Tau Sigma is an academic honor society designed specifically to “recognize and promote the academic excellence and involvement of transfer students.”
Purpose-Tau Sigma accomplishes its mission by establishing chapters at four year institutions across the country, recognizing the academic achievement of the most outstanding transfers nationwide and, in the process, helping universities better serve their transfer populations. Tau Sigma members (among the most accomplished transfer students on campus) are perhaps the greatest resource available to serve the current and future transfers at our institution.
Organization Description-Tau Sigma recognizes the academic excellence of transfer students, while encouraging and promoting involvement in the University community, especially in activities that assist other transfer students in making a successful transition.
Students are invited to join the organization after completing one semester (12 semester credit hours or more) and earning at least a 3.5 GPA at UTD.
Invitations are sent during the spring semester after a student’s first semester at UT Dallas. For more information, visit the Tau Sigma National Honor Society website.

Title: TEDxUTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: TEDx was created in the spirit of TED's mission, "ideas worth spreading," supporting independent organizers who want to create a TED-like event in their own community. TEDxUTD expands on this mission, bringing ideas worth spreading to UT Dallas.

Title: Teen Learning Wizards
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to provide quality and free academic mentorship for students from underprivileged communities.

Title: Telugu Students Federation
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Telugu Students Federation aims to promote and celebrate the rich culture and heritage of the Telugu language and associated traditions. Through cultural events, community-building initiatives, and collaboration, we aim to ensure the preservation and sharing of our heritage, connecting Telugu students across the campus.

Title: Texas Chi Chapter of Sigma Alpha Epsilon
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The True Gentleman is the man whose conduct proceeds from good will and an acute sense of propriety, and whose self-control is equal to all emergencies; who does not make the poor man conscious of his poverty, the obscure man of his obscurity, or any man of his inferiority or deformity; who is himself humbled if necessity compels him to humble another; who does not flatter wealth, cringe before power, or boast of his own possessions or achievements; who speaks with frankness but always with sincerity and sympathy; whose deed follows his word; who thinks of the rights and feelings of others, rather than his own; and who appears well in any company, a man with whom honor is sacred and virtue safe.

Title: Texas Rising UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Texas Rising is a nonpartisan movement of young, diverse Texans leveraging power through community organizing and issue-based advocacy. We work to facilitate greater student awareness of the legislation that impacts our daily lives, and provide opportunities for students to get directly involved with policymaking whilst building coalitions to make a difference on the ground in marginalized communities.

Title: The Accounting Club (TAC)
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To support the UT Dallas accounting community by creating network opportunities, developing professional skills, and educating students about the various accounting career paths. By encouraging students to step outside the classroom and engage with each other and accounting professionals, we aim to build positive relationships between students and faculty at UT Dallas, and the Dallas/Fort Worth accounting community.

Title: The American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The objective of the organization is to further, within its locality, the purposes and programs of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics within The University of Texas at Dallas. The organization shall also raise awareness about the industry and assist engineering students in their advancement in the field of aeronautics and astronautics. It is also the AIAA UT Dallas’s objective to foster the professional development of the students and to support and promote local, regional, national, and international AIAA programs.

Title: The American Red Cross Club at the University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The The American Red Cross Club at the University of Texas at Dallas is functioning under the guidance and auspices of the North Texas Region of the American Red Cross of the American Red Cross, hereinafter “region” is considered an extension of that Region/Station rather than an independent Red Cross entity. Guided by the fundamental principles of the American Red Cross and its mission to prevent and alleviate human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors, the The American Red Cross Club at the University of Texas at Dallas will learn, practice and exemplify humanitarian values through mission-related service projects.
Club will plan and coordinate a minimum of three Red Cross mission-related service projects per year. The service projects will focus on blood, fundraising, education and preparedness, International Humanitarian Law, and social engagement.

Title: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to enhance the educational experience of mechanical engineering students at The University of Texas at Dallas by offering opportunities for hands-on experience, networking, and professional development that will assist them in achieving their future professional goals.

Title: The Animation Guild at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The purpose of the Guild shall be to represent and serve students pursuing careers in the animation industry.
This includes but is not limited to:
(1) Providing a fun and welcoming environment to encourage comradery.
(2) Hosting speakers and networking events to spread industry knowledge.
(3) Sharing educational resources to support personal growth and success.

Title: The Association of Women in Psychology
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission Statement: Our mission is to provide a platform in which women pursuing careers in the many fields of psychology are encouraged to share their personal endeavors as they receive support and guidance from peers with similar goals.

Organization Description: TAWP emphasizes the interaction between feminism and Psychology, and the role that female empowerment plays in the academic and career-related success of psychology students. Although we were founded with a focus on women pursuing a career in the many fields of psychology, we are inclusive of all genders and majors. Anyone is welcome who is interested in learning more/finding a community that shares these ideas.

Title: The Comet Symphonique at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To promote both instrumental music throughout the campus and encourage membership of students with musical experience as well as the desire to be involved in the musical arts, including String Orchestra, Wind Ensemble, Brass Ensemble, Jazz Ensemble, and University Orchestra.

Title: The Community Health Advocate
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Community Health Advocate (CHA) is dedicated to bridging the gap between students and Community Health professionals. We offer members a chance to gain experience, knowledge, and immersion in the field of Community Health. The CHA focuses on empowering future leaders of tomorrow and providing them with a platform to advocate for Community Health reform.

Title: The Community Health Advocate
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The CHA is dedicated towards educating and empowering healthcare leaders of the future. Everyone deserves the opportunity to serve their community as they see fit, and the CHA wants to build the bridges that connect dedicated students to at-risk populations. Healthcare is more than just medicine or policy, it’s about humanity. The CHA wants to humanize the way we view Community Health policy and provide a platform for students to do so.

Title: The Cyber Defense and Response Unit
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The mission of this organization is to foster academic exploration and build a robust community of defense-oriented cyber professionals. We are committed to training the next generation of cyber defenders by offering comprehensive education, training, and hands-on experiences in key areas such as digital forensics, incident response, and cyber defense. Our goal is to equip our members with the skills and knowledge necessary to protect individuals and organizations, while promoting ethical and responsible practices in the field of cybersecurity.

Title: The Dialogue Society
Category: Academic Interests, Cultural, Social, Special Interest
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Dialogue Society's purpose is to create a platform that values inclusion and continuous learning, where people from different cultures, ideologies and backgrounds can come together and connect through meaningful conversations. Our aim is to focus on the exchange of values and foster intercultural dialogue through a range of activities such as educational events, social/cultural programs, volunteering and leadership initiatives. Through learning from each other, we hope to achieve a shared understanding of differences and serve the community in various ways.

Title: The Drawing Sessions
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Drawing Session is a fine arts club whose purpose is to provide a place for UTD students of all majors to improve their skills through figure drawing and other drawing activities. This club will foster a positive environment for people of all skill levels to participate in.

Title: The Fashion Club at the University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Fashion Club is a safe haven for creativity and self-expression through fashion. Our mission is to offer a platform for designers and models to express their talents. We work on connecting members with fashion professionals, teach those interested about the fashion industry, and host social events.

Title: The Historical Swordfighting Guild of UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: SFGUTD aims to study historical Italian longsword, and other historical forms of combat such as saber, messer, or even historical wrestling. We learn from reconstructed and translated historical combat manuals written by fencing masters from the 1400's onward. The modern martial practiced by combatants such as us is referred to as HEMA, or Historical European Martial Arts, or just Historical Fencing.

Title: The Ismaili Muslim Students Association at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: IMSA is an organization meant to bridge the gaps between Ismaili Muslim students at UTD and bring them together over several events. We host socials, networking panels, community service events, and mentorship programs meant for the students to gain a sense of belonging on campus and make new friends/connections.

Title: The John Marshal Pre-Law Society
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of the society shall be to promote the understanding of the legal profession, the law, and government operation; to assist its members in the processes of entering the legal profession; and to recognize and encourage scholarship and leadership among pre-law students at The University of Texas at Dallas.

Title: The Lavender Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our club is dedicated to discussing and raising awareness on current events for queer women and nonbinary people, advocating for equity, and fundraising for LGBTQ+ charities. This club intends to foster a safe and welcoming environment for those who feel ostracized and encourage those to facilitate their voices. Finally, we strive to create close relationships and build a community for young queer women and nonbinary students at UTD.

Title: The Mercury
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: UTD's student-run newspaper since 1980. During the fall and spring semesters, we publish an issue every two weeks; during the summer semester, every three weeks. If you are interested in being hired as a writer/reporter, graphics artist, or photographer, please email our editor-in-chief at editor@utdmercury.com to learn more about the application process. If you would like to write an op-ed, see our website for more information. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions, and don't hesitate to check us out on social media or on our website.

Title: The Product Base
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The Product Base Club is a student organization club for students to develop a deeper understanding and gain hands-on experience in Product Management through expert sessions,
workshops, and case studies.

Mission: We are on a mission to spread awareness about Product Management to UT Dallas
students.

Vision: Our vision is to help and train UT Dallas students ti be successful Product Managers that
are effective contributors to the company.

Title: The Product League
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The Product League is a student-led organization at the University of Texas at Dallas (UTD) that focuses on product management education and professional development. The organization aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of product management through a variety of activities, events, and programs.

Product League offers various workshops, speaker events, and networking opportunities to its members. These events are designed to help students learn about the product management industry, improve their skills, and connect with industry professionals. Additionally, the organization provides its members with access to job postings and internship opportunities in product management.

The organization is run by a team of UTD students who are passionate about product management and dedicated to helping other students succeed in the field. Product League is open to all UTD students who are interested in product management, regardless of their major or background.

Overall, Product League is an excellent resource for UTD students who want to learn more about product management and build a career in the field. By joining the organization, students can gain valuable knowledge and skills, as well as connect with like-minded individuals and industry professionals.

Title: The Quality Assurance Organization
Category: Academic Interests, Art and Music, Services, Special Interest
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Test, Document, Improve'- Quality Assurance Organization is a student organization focused on learning QA practices, bug testing products, and just having a good time breaking (mostly digital) things. QAO tests any student-made project, regardless of medium. We hope to offer hands-on QA experience and provide students valuable feedback on their projects!

Title: The Real Estate Club at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Mission: To create opportunities for students within the real estate industry that educates, inform and inspires.

Vision: Through programming, education, and alumni & industry engagement the UTD Real Estate Club will provide educational opportunities, enhance the University’s visibility in the real estate community, and help students cultivate opportune relationships. These outcomes will position UTD students to attain employment in the real estate industry’s most coveted career paths.

Title: The Riichi Mahjong Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Mahjong is a traditional Asian game that is unique from all of the other tabletop games. The Riichi Mahjong Club values sportsmanship and the spirit of competition. We encourage important skills like observation, risk management, and strategy. Since there are many international students in UTD and mahjong is famous in Asia, we hope this mahjong club can help American students to touch the Asian culture, and help those international students to find their fellows.

Title: The SpongeBob Club at the University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: A social club where UTD students can get together and commiserate together on their college experiences, while knowing that we all have at least one thing in common: we all like SpongeBob SquarePants.

Title: The Taekwondo Club at The University of Texas at Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Taekwondo Club at The University of Texas at Dallas is a recreational group that aims to teach Taekwondo to students of all skill levels who are interested in the sport. The curriculum includes patterns, sparring, and general kicking techniques. This organization also aims to provide a community for students to support each other and socialize.

Title: The Texas Humanitarian Initiative
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The purpose of the Club is to promote public health and humanitarian efforts by:
• Cleaning up streets and public spaces in Texas to enhance the overall well-being of the community.
• Promoting sustainable practices to protect the environment and improve public health.
• Diminishing misinformation related to public health by educating the public through various means.
• Advocating for public health policies and initiatives that benefit the people of Texas.

Title: The University of Texas at Dallas Undergraduate Law Review
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The purpose of the law review shall be to develop critical and analytical thinking, interdisciplinary dialogue, and academic excellence by studying and practicing the skills of legal research and writing. The law review aims to create an academic forum where students can engage in discourse and the free exchange of ideas with an emphasis on legal scholarship, regardless of desire or intention to pursue a higher education in legal studies or the legal industry. Ultimately, participation in the law review will help develop students into more active members of their community, locally, nationally, and globally.

The law review shall produce and publish scholarly written content as its primary work. An annual journal composed of long-form legal writing, consistent with the Chicago Style citation format, is the central publication of the law review. This format will be used until comprehensive training for Bluebook citation style is developed for all staff, after which the organization will transition to Bluebook citations. The law review may also publish other forms of work, including short- form publications, notes, articles, or multimedia that align with the purpose of the law review.

The law review shall hold meetings and events, as outlined in Article IV, for the efficient management of the law review, sufficient training, and mentorship for its membership, and facilitating organized, respectful, and academic forums for the exchange of ideas.

Title: The UTD Pre-Physician Assistant Society
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Provide students with opportunities and information pertaining to becoming a more well-rounded applicant for Physician Assistant School including but not limited to guest speakers, community service events, networking, etc. Inform students of the history and purpose of the PA profession as well as information pertaining to admission requirements for PA schools and the application process. To form a support system of like-minded individuals who strive to become the best PA school applicants that they can be.

Title: Theta Tau (Alpha) UTD Fraternity
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of this fraternity shall be to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship by engaging its members in career-enriching projects and industry connections. Our mission is to provide an affordable professional Greek life where students can be part of a brotherhood that provides career-building, and network opportunities.

Title: Thirst Project
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Thirst Project is a nonprofit organization that works with the support of young people to END the global water crisis by building freshwater wells in developing communities that need safe, clean drinking water. Why Water? Health and Sanitation: Waterborne diseases kill more children every single year than HIV, Malaria, and all world violence combined. Small children typically do not have strong enough immune systems to fight diseases like cholera, dysentery, or schistosomiasis.

Title: True Crime Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of True Criminology Association is to spread knowledge about true crime and criminology from many parts of the world. In addition, TCA plans to educate its members on safety and preventative measures in hopes of instilling awareness in students at the University of Texas at Dallas.

Title: TTRPG Club (Tabletop RPG)
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of this organization shall be: to provide an open and friendly environment for players to engage in tabletop role-playing games and their associated systems and subcultures; to organize events and programs designed to provide UT Dallas students the chance to participate and learn about tabletop gaming; to facilitate and encourage the hobby of tabletop gaming as a meaningful social outlet and pastime.

Title: Turkish Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to elevate the Turkish community globally through cultural alliance, professional development, and opportunities.

Title: Turning Point USA at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Identify, educate, train, and organize students to promote the principles of freedom, free markets, and limited government. Turning Point USA guides citizens through development of knowledge, skills, values, and motivation, so they can meaningfully engage in their communities to restore traditional American values like patriotism, respect for life, liberty, family, and fiscal responsibility.

Title: Undergraduate Accounting Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Undergraduate Accounting Club is directed towards promoting the knowledge of the accounting profession and preparing future business leaders for career prospects. The club organizes events enabling students to learn more about the accounting profession from faculty members and accomplished accounting professionals including Fortune 500 companies. The club also conducts skill development workshops and networking events, bridging the gap between students and professionals.

Title: UNICEF at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We at UNICEF at UTD strive to create a welcoming environment for the members to grow through service and leadership. The club provides volunteering opportunities to help the Richardson community and leave a lasting impact on the UTD community. Through the club, we host fundraising events to raise money for global and local causes on a yearly basis. The club creates a great avenue for individuals to learn about the current events of the world and play a small part in helping the global community. We are looking forward to meeting everyone and creating memories that last a lifetime.

Title: Unicycle Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To teach the art and sport of unicycling and foster the UTD community of unicyclists! All levels are welcome and unicycles are provided.

Title: United Mission for Relief and Development
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: UMR mission is to bring students passionate about community service and development together. Chapters serve their local communities with events such as Project Downtown, where we donate meals to food bank and other initiatives to make them a better place to live. As well as support UMR’s international initiatives through awareness raising, youth mobilization, professional development training and community service outreach.

Title: University Blood Initiative
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: UTD Blood Initiative is dedicated to service, healthcare, and community. We host on-campus blood drives and offer related volunteer opportunities every single month. We also foster an educated community through pre-medical and other general professional and social events.

Title: User Experience (UX) Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The UX Club at UT Dallas aims to increase awareness and create a community around user centered design. We strive to learn, understand and create well-designed experiences. We give you the resources to bring clients and concepts together and teach you how to blend empathy, art, and software. We teach you how to design the future.

Title: UTD Service Dogs in Training (SIT) FKA Collegiate Canine Companions for Independence
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Purpose: The purpose of UTD Service Dogs in Training (SIT) is to encourage The University of Texas at Dallas (hereafter referred to as UT Dallas) students, staff, and faculty to serve the community as volunteers for Canine Companions for Independence through puppy raising, fundraising, and spreading assistance dog awareness to UT Dallas and the community with support and guidance from the organization.

Mission: UTD SIT is focused on pairing higher education with the rewarding experience of working with assistance dogs. The organization will accomplish this by “Assisting Outstanding People to Raise Outstanding Assistance Dogs.”

Organization Description: UTD Service Dogs in Training (SIT) is a Canine Companions-affiliated college organization that seeks to pair higher education with the experience of raising and working with service dogs. The organization supports the unique experience of college puppy raisers by spreading service dog awareness, fundraising, training puppy sitters, and by working with UTD staff and faculty to allow for the SIT puppies to go to classes and events.

Title: UTD Students Demand Action
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: UTD Students Demand Action’s main goal is to spark a conversation and change about gun reform, specifically in the DFW area, given that we’ve sadly been affected by this epidemic in our community. Our plan is to connect, educate, and be a call to action students to to be advocates in gun reform.

Title: UTDesign Makerspace
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The mission of UTDesign Makerspace is to provide an environment of innovation, collaboration, and education where Makers can develop their skills and projects among their peers with access to current and next-generation technology.

Title: UTDuelists
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: To provide students on campus a local place to explore their interests and hobbies relating to trading card games and learn about one of the world's largest TCG's "Yu-Gi-Oh!" with other students in a friendly manner without needing to buy cards or drive to card shops in both casual and competitive styles of gameplay.

Title: UTeaD Tea and Coffee Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: UTeaD is a campus organization whose primary purpose is to allow students to experience various types of tea and coffee from around the world, as well as learn about and engage in a wide variety of brewing styles and cultural practices associated with said beverages. Members have the opportunity to share their own experiences and culture while learning from others. Furthermore, the organization serves a secondary purpose of providing students with an informal space to socialize, network, and engage with students of differing backgrounds over a common interest.

Title: Vaalmeengal Tamil Sangam
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
The mission of UTD Vaalmeengal Tamil Sangam is to provide a mutually supportive and positive learning environment in which every individual member has the opportunity to develop communication and leadership skills.
Vaalmeengal Tamil Sangam is an organization bringing together Tamil people from all walks of life together and celebrating the Tamil Language and culture to preserve connection to the roots.

Title: Valorant Club UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of the Valorant Club is to provide a fun and safe space for casual and esports players alike to congregate and find solidarity among fellow gamers.

Title: Vibha UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our goal for the Vibha Chapter at the University of Texas at Dallas is to establish internal and external operations to increase awareness of the lack of educational resources in India while also positively impacting students with personalized mentorship. Vibha is a volunteer-driven non-profit organization that provides educational opportunities for underprivileged children. Founded in 1991, Vibha has established a presence in 46 cities and is constantly expanding through the increased interest of our volunteers.

Title: Vida Volunteer
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to promote human and animal health by bringing together the efforts of students, communities and the local healthcare systems. Our vision is to become leaders in the human and animal Health Promotion Movement, through service learning experiences in Central America.

Title: Vietnamese International Network of Culture, Education and Friendship
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Vincef is an organization dedicated to Vietnamese foreign students at UT Dallas. Our mission is promote cultural exchange, education, and friendship between Vietnam and the international community. Our aim is to build bridges of understanding and mutual respect between nations and cultures, and to contribute to the development of a peaceful and prosperous global society

Title: Vietnamese Language Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: VLA is an educational club designed to help any UTD students, faculty, or staff improve their Vietnamese language skills. This could range from members completely new to the language as well as advanced students at the university who are simply looking to review concepts or practice conversation. VLA will also point members to applicable resources depending on their level. The goal is to prepare members for their personal goals regarding the Vietnamese language, which could be social, educational, or professional in nature.

Title: Vietnamese Student Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Spread Vietnamese culture and create a family of close knit members that prioritize adventure and community.

Title: Volunteer Proofreaders for Project Gutenberg
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Volunteer Proofreaders for Project Gutenberg was formed to provide a completely virtual volunteer opportunity and bring awareness to the vast availability of open access public domain ebooks and online sources. We work together with the 501(c)3 nonprofit ‘Project Gutenberg’ and their affiliate ‘Distributed Proofreaders’. Our organization values philanthropy, access to free information, preserving history, and increasing the knowledge and resources available for our current and future generations.

As a volunteer, you will be given a side-by-side screen of a scanned page from a copyright-free book and a program-generated text that should match the scan. Your job is simply to check for any mistakes that were made in the program’s scan, while also following certain guidelines for formatting the text. These corrections are simple and easy to do, and you can work from your personal laptop at any time. No prior experience is required, and there are no minimum or maximum hours required for membership.

To get started, click on the forms tab, watch our asynchronous orientation video, and fill out the accompanying form.

If you have further questions, please reach out to Manish Samson, manish.samson@utdallas.edu.

Title: Water Polo at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Water Polo at UTD is an organization dedicated to bringing students together to play water polo. Through the sport, students will gain teamwork and communication skills and forge strong bonds in and out of the water.

Title: Wesley at UT Dallas
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The Synergy Wesley Foundation is a diverse and affirming campus ministry that provides a supportive space for college students to build authentic relationships and community, grow in faith, discover their gifts, and develop as leaders to transform the world. We celebrate diversity, and welcome and affirm all students. We are LGBTQ-affirming and part of the UTD Rainbow Coalition. We are affiliated with the United Methodist Church, but students do not need to be Methodist (or even Christian) to join!

Title: WeTeach
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
ARTICLE II: Purpose
The purpose of WeTeach at UTD shall be to assemble students who aspire to be teachers, promote STEM education on and off campus, and provide professional development enrichment in a fun, engaging environment.

Title: Wind Energy Club
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: We are a UT Dallas student organization focused on training the new generation of professionals within the Green Tech Industries. Within this scope, our mission is to aid in the global and national renewable energy transition and the implementation of equitable and transformative solutions. We actively participate in the U.S Department of Energy Collegiate Wind Competition through our competition team "Comet Wind", where we compete in the three sub-contests including the design and construction of a small-scale wind turbine.

Title: WinSTEM
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Win STEM at UT Dallas is a charitable, service-oriented organization aimed at supporting and recruiting ambitious women to pursue STEM careers through building confidence, community engagement, and opportunity guidance.

Title: Wishmakers
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our mission is to raise money to donate to the Make-a-Wish foundation to aid children who are ill. We organize and execute events where we fundraise and engage students on campus to spread awareness of the organization.

Title: Women and Children Outreach Program
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of this service organization is to be an outreach program for the UT Dallas students in which we will serve the underprivileged community in the DFW area. Specifically, targeting women and children affected by domestic violence and homelessness. Through this organization, we hope to involve the students in volunteering opportunities, fundraising for various causes, mentorship programs for the UTD community, and spreading awareness of the impact of domestic violence and homelessness.

Title: Women Engineers Hack
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: This organization aims to create an inclusive environment that highlights and empowers women, femme, non-binary, and gender-nonconforming students in the tech industry. The organization encourages more underrepresented individuals to harness their skills by creating software or hardware projects through hackathons.

Title: Women For Welfare
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Helping domestic abuse victims through fundraising and volunteering.

Title: Women in Animation at UT Dallas
Category: Academic Interests, Art and Music, Social
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of WIA is to bring together a community of current and future animation professionals to empower and support women, gender queer, and non-binary identifying students in the art, science, and business of animation. WIA's goal is to promote diversity in leadership roles for underrepresented communities and reach 50/50 representation by 2025 in the animation and games industries.

Title: Women in Cybersecurity at UTD
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr:
Our chapter encourages women to pursue careers in the highly dynamic and expansive field of cybersecurity by offering tools, events, and networking opportunities throughout the year.

The purposes and goals of WiCyS are:
1. To support, engage, and encourage women pursuing careers in fields of cybersecurity.
2. To provide opportunities for personal and professional development while cultivating a
community of individuals with similar goals and interests.

Title: Women in Neuroscience
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our purpose is to provide resources, mentorship, and friendship to our members, with the goal of empowering women in the field of neuroscience. We aim to create a network where women who are completing their PhD in Neuroscience are supported in their personal experiences by peers navigating similar experiences.

Title: Women in Research Association
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Our association is dedicated to empowering women in research by fostering a supportive community, providing resources, and advocating for gender equality in all fields of research. We create a dynamic and inclusive environment where women researchers from diverse backgrounds and disciplines can thrive professionally and personally. Through networking opportunities, mentorship programs, and advocacy efforts, we aim to enhance the careers of women in research and eliminate barriers to their advancement. Join us as we work towards creating a more equitable research landscape and empowering women to reach their full potential.

Title: Women in Technology & Business
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Women in Technology & Business is a professional organization to support and empower women in technology and business fields and provide them with resources to be successful. In addition, WITB aims to break down the stereotypes surrounding technology and business fields, expose more people to how technology can impact their career path, and encourage more women to join technology and business fields.

Title: Women Mentoring Women In Engineering
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: The purpose of Women Mentoring Women in Engineering is to increase retention of women in the engineering workplace through providing access to long-term and recurring mentoring relationships with women in industry or with graduate students on their respective college campuses.

In an industry where women face unique obstacles such as gender inequality, WPL will be a source of information, education, and inspiration to help future women and non-binary conforming leaders enter the field with confidence.

Title: Women Who Compute
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: At Women Who Compute, we are dedicated to the empowerment and advancement of women in engineering and computer science.

Title: Womens Lacrosse at UTD

Title: Women's Pickleball Club

This club offers opportunities for women to connect, socialize, and improve their pickleball skills through organized games, events, and activities. By promoting fitness, friendship, and a sense of belonging among its members.

Title: XR UTD

Title: Young Democratic Socialists of America

We are students organizing in our university to fight for the immediate needs of students and workers while building our capacity to fight for more structural changes.

Title: Young Life
Mission, Purpose, and Organization Descr: Young Life College values students, their futures, and most importantly their purpose. Our hope is that through deep friendships, camaraderie, adventure and community that students will feel deeply connected to one another as well as connected better to their campus. Our beliefs are that every student has a God given purpose for their lives, and in that they can find true peace and inspiration for their gifts and design. We are super inviting to any and all students on campus, and we plan to support every student in every way possible both with mentorships and friendships.
